A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
I am not a bot or a troll.  I just did not like that movie.  I could give a list (a long one) of reasons why this movie didn't sit well with me\, but that has already been done extensively on this website by other reviewers and I agree with most of them.  

Among this movies biggest failures were: Pacing - giving too much time and attention to plots with holes or that go no where.
Character development: neglecting Rey\, Finn and Poe and wasting time on new characters that are unlikeable (Rose and Porgs).
Inconsistencies: It is like this movie forgot it is part of a franchise.  It doesn't behave like a Star Wars movie and fails to connect any dots with past movies and where it could logically go from here.

I am very confused how this movie is still holding at 49% audience approval.  It looks to me that for every 5 star review there are at least double the amount of 1/2 or 1 star reviews.  Something fishy going on with the tomatometer indeed.
